author: The Editorial Board
title: Crowding Out K-12 Education
text:
Oklahoma teachers ended their nine-day strike Thursday—and had little to show for it despite demands for a $10,000 raise. But at least a dozen Sooner teachers filed paperwork to run for state office last week, and teachers are agitating for more money around the country. So it’s worth looking to see what’s really pinching school spending.
Following the nationwide trend, Medicaid has taken a growing toll on Oklahoma’s budget. In 2017 the health-care program that is supposedly for the poor consumed nearly 25% of the state’s...
